definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
pleasantly surprised like mad (idiom); capering madly with joy/to express boundless pleasure

sentences.english: This would not have been a surprise to Cyril Fagan.
sentences.chinese: 這對西里爾費根來說不會是一個驚喜。

sentences.english: There was a time when every moment was infused with hope and wonder.
sentences.chinese: 生命中曾有段時期充滿著希望和驚喜。

sentences.english: You never cease to amaze me, Louie.
sentences.chinese: 你沒有停止給我驚喜，路易。

sentences.english: Clearly this was a profitable happenstance for both the owners and the king.
sentences.chinese: 顯然後者對於農場主和國王來說都是收益頗豐的驚喜。

sentences.english: It' really surprises me that Xiao gives me an ticket of Olympic.
sentences.chinese: 確實比較驚喜，老肖居然送我一張奧運門票。

sentences.english: There were other pleasant surprises, notably in rowing and roller-blading.
sentences.chinese: 同時划船和旱冰都得到了意外驚喜。

sentences.english: Suddenly the father put down a bowl chopsticks, son some surprise gain ground.
sentences.chinese: 忽然父親放下碗筷，兒女有些驚喜地擡頭。

sentences.english: They acquire wildness and some of the surprises that the wild entails.
sentences.chinese: 他們獲得了野性，並因野性而獲得一些意外和驚喜。

sentences.english: He took the egg home. To his delight, he found that it was an egg of pure gold.
sentences.chinese: 他將蛋帶回家，驚喜地發現這是一個金蛋。

sentences.english: Dazzle her with these one of a kind sapphire and diamond earrings.
sentences.chinese: 這款精緻炫目的藍寶石鑽石耳環一定令她驚喜不已。

sentences.english: The surprises will be announced once we are prepositioned to accomplish them.
sentences.chinese: 的驚喜將公佈一次，我們預先實現這些目標。

sentences.english: She said she was having a surprise party for Lana on Friday night.
sentences.chinese: 她說星期五她要舉行一個爲蘭娜準備的驚喜聚會。

sentences.english: Children always surprise us with their unconditional love.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子那種無條件的愛，常令我們驚喜。

sentences.english: Mixing charm with her trademark sarcasm, she is always full of surprises.
sentences.chinese: 她的諷刺煥發着獨特的魅力，時時刻刻充滿了驚喜。

sentences.english: However, they can always give a suprise to those who are willing to do and help.
sentences.chinese: 但它總是能給予樂意行動和支付的人以驚喜。

sentences.english: Since it’s a surprise, there’s no possibility for disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這是一個驚喜，所以沒有讓她失望的可能。

definition: to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
